sent: How we make changes to this policy

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We added more details about data we collect and how it's used, along with a new way to control whether it is used to report on ads performance.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We added new information for our California residents.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Thank you for using Pinterest!

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Our mission is to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To do that, we show you personalized content and ads we think you’ll be interested in based on information we collect from you and third parties.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We only use that information where we have a proper legal basis for doing so.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We wrote this policy to help you understand what information we collect, how we use it and what choices you have about it.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Because we’re an internet company, some of the concepts below are a little technical, but we’ve tried our best to explain things in a simple and clear way.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We welcome your questions and comments on this policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: When you give it to us or give us permission to obtain it When you sign up for or use Pinterest you voluntarily share certain information including your name, email address, phone number, photos, Pins, comments, and any other information you give us.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You will also have the option to share other information about yourself such as your gender, age and preferred language.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you connect your Facebook, Google or other third-party accounts to Pinterest, we use information from those accounts (such as your friends or contacts) to improve your Pinterest experience.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: This is dependent on the privacy policies or settings for those accounts.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We also get technical information when you use Pinterest When you use a website, mobile application or other internet service, certain internet and electronic network activity information gets created and logged automatically.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: This is also true when you use Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Here are some of the types of information we collect:   Log data.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: When you use Pinterest, our servers record information (“log data”), including information that your browser automatically sends whenever you visit a website, or that your mobile app automatically sends when you’re using it.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: This log data includes your Internet Protocol address (which we use to infer your approximate location), the address of and activity on websites you visit that incorporate Pinterest features (like the “Save” button—more details below), searches, browser type and settings, the date and time of your request, how you used Pinterest, cookie data and device data.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can learn more about the log data we collect here.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We also use “cookies” (small text files sent by your computer each time you visit our website, unique to your Pinterest account or your browser) or similar technologies to get log data.
point_text: We also use “cookies” (small text files sent by your computer each time you visit our website, unique to your Pinterest account or your browser) or similar technologies to get log data.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, we use cookies to store your language preferences or other settings so you don‘t have to set them up every time you visit Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Some of the cookies we use are associated with your Pinterest account (including information about you, such as the email address you gave us) and other cookies are not.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For more detailed information about how we use cookies, please review our Cookie Policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: In addition to log data, we collect information about the device you’re using Pinterest on, including the type of device, operating system, settings, unique device identifiers and crash data that helps us understand when something breaks.
point_text: In addition to log data, we collect information about the device you’re using Pinterest on, including the type of device, operating system, settings, unique device identifiers and crash data that helps us understand when something breaks.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: When you’re on Pinterest, we use your activity—such as which Pins you click on, boards you create, and any text that you add in a comment or description—along with information you provided when you first signed up and information from our partners and advertisers to make inferences about you and your preferences.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if you create a board about travel, we may infer you are a travel enthusiast.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We may also infer information about your education or professional experience based on your activity when you link your account to accounts you have with third parties like Facebook or Google.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Our partners and advertisers share information with us We also get information about you and your activity outside Pinterest from our affiliates, advertisers, partners and other third parties we work with.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example:  Some websites or apps use Pinterest features such as our “Save” button, or you may install our “Save” button for your browser.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If so, we collect log data from those sites or apps.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can learn more about these features at our Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Learn more about the types of information advertisers or other third parties share with us.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To do that, we use your information to provide and improve your experience, including:  Identify you when you use Pinterest.
point_text: To do that, we use your information to provide and improve your experience, including:
point_title: Your personal data is used for advertising

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Recommend Pins, boards, topics or categories you might like based on your activity on Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if we see you’re into cooking, we may suggest food-related Pins, boards or people that we think you might like, or show you food-related ads.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Respond to your questions or comments.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We have a legitimate interest for using your info in these ways.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: It's fundamental to what we do at Pinterest and necessary in order to make Pinterest and its features relevant and personalized to you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We also have a legitimate interest in making Pinterest safe and improving our product features so you keep finding the inspiration you want.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We all benefit when we use your information to:  Suggest other people who have similar interests.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if you follow interior design boards, we may suggest interior designers that you might like.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Help your friends and contacts find you on Pinterest, if you agree to this in your settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if you sign up using a Facebook account, we can help your Facebook friends find you on Pinterest when they first sign up for Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Or people can search for your account on Pinterest using your email.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Work with law enforcement and keep Pinterest safe.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We may get requests for account information from law enforcement authorities like the police or courts.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To find out more about how we respond to law enforcement requests, please see our Law Enforcement Guidelines.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Review your messages on Pinterest to detect activity that poses a risk to the safety of you, our community and/or members of the public.
point_text: Review your messages on Pinterest to detect activity that poses a risk to the safety of you, our community and/or members of the public.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Improve Pinterest and offer new features.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Advertise Pinterest products and services to you on other sites.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can choose for us not to share your information with other sites to personalize those ads as described in the “Choices you have about your information” section below.
point_text: You can choose for us not to share your information with other sites to personalize those ads as described in the “Choices you have about your information” section below.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Send you updates (such as when certain activity, like saves or comments, happens on Pinterest) and news by email or push notification, depending on your settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, we send weekly updates that include Pins you may like.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can decide to stop getting these notifications by updating your settings.
point_text: You can decide to stop getting these notifications by updating your settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We have a legitimate interest in delivering ads that are relevant, interesting and personal to you in order to generate revenue.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To further these interests we use the information we collect to:  Decide which ads to show you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if you show an interest in camping tents on Pinterest, we may show you ads for other outdoor products.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We customize the ad content we show you by identifying your interests based on your onsite and offsite activities, as well as by using information we receive from ad partners or other third parties.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Where we use cookies to identify your offsite interests, we’ll get your consent where we need to.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Where ad partners or other third parties share information with us about you, we rely on the consent they already obtained.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Tell our ad partners how their Pinterest ads are doing, and how to make them better.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Some of this information is aggregated.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, we would report to an advertiser that a certain percentage of people who viewed a Promoted Pin went on to visit that advertiser's site.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: In other instances, this information isn’t aggregated.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, we would let an advertiser know that a particular Promoted Pin has been saved by certain people.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To find out more about reporting on ads please visit the Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: When we identify your interests based on your offsite behavior with cookies, we will obtain any consent that we may need.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To find out more about how we use cookies, please see our Cookie Policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: In addition to the specific circumstances above, we’ll only use your information with your consent in order to:  Allow searching with photos.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if you take a photo of a pair of shoes or a piece of furniture you like, you can ask us to show you similar items.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can opt in to this in your device operating system settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Send you marketing materials by email, text, push notification or phone call depending on your account or operating system settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Each time we send you marketing materials, we give you the option to unsubscribe.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Identify your precise location and customize the content we show you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if we know that you’re near a retailer we may show you that retailer’s Pins that may be of interest to you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can opt in to this in your device operating system settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Tell our ad partners how their ads are doing using the Pinterest Tag.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: The Pinterest Tag (a piece of code an advertiser puts on their site) delivers insights to us and our ad partners about actions that a person takes on their website after viewing an ad on Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To learn more about the Pinterest Tag, please visit the Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We’ll also rely on your consent where we use cookies to:  Identify you across different browser sessions.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: This means if you log into Pinterest from your phone (or any device), we'll remember that you're you and then you won't need to enter your login details each time you visit Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Show you ads you might be interested in.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We use cookies to identify your interests based on your offsite activity.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We do this for people currently using Pinterest and for new folks, and it helps us customize how you get started on Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To find out more about how we use cookies, and your choices about how we use them, please see our Cookie Policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Transferring your information   Pinterest is a worldwide service.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: By using our products or services, you authorize us to transfer and store your information outside your home country, including in the United States, for the purposes described in this policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: The privacy protections and the rights of authorities to access your personal information in such countries may not be equivalent to those of your home country.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: See the section for EEA Residents to learn more about data transfers to and from that region.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Choices you have about your info   Our goal is to give you simple and meaningful choices regarding your information.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you have a Pinterest account, many of these controls are built directly into Pinterest or your settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, you can:  Edit information in your profile at any time, decide whether your profile is available to search engines, or choose whether others can find your Pinterest account using your email address.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Link or unlink your Pinterest account from other services (like Facebook, Google or Twitter).

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For some services (like Facebook), you can also decide whether or not to publish your Pinterest activity to that service.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Secret boards are visible to you and other collaborators in the board, and any collaborator may choose to make the board available to anyone else.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, another collaborator can invite someone else to the board, make the board available to an app they use to view Pinterest, or even just take an image from the board and email it to their friends.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Choose whether Pinterest will be customized for you using information from other websites or apps.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you have a Pinterest account and want to control how your offsite data is used to tailor your experience, you can visit your settings and update your “Personalization” preferences.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Choose whether Pinterest ads delivered to you on other platforms, sites or apps are customized using information about your account activities.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can control this by visiting your settings and updating your “Personalization” preferences.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Choose whether Pinterest shares information about your activity on Pinterest for ads performance reporting.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can control this by visiting your settings and updating your “Personalization” preferences.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Close your account at any time.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: When you close your account, we’ll deactivate it, remove your Pins and boards from Pinterest and delete your account data.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Please note that there may be legal reasons for us to keep your data, such as if we receive a law enforcement request asking us to preserve data.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We may also retain certain information in our backup systems for a limited period of time, or as required by law.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We also support settings such as Limit Ad Tracking in iOS, Ads Personalization in Android devices as well as Do Not Track in browsers.
point_text: We also support settings such as Limit Ad Tracking in iOS, Ads Personalization in Android devices as well as Do Not Track in browsers.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Learn more about how Do Not Track affects our collection and use of data collected off of Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You also have choices available to you through the device or software you use to access Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example:  The browser you use lets you control cookies or other types of local data storage.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Your mobile device lets you choose how and whether your precise location, photos, contacts and other data is shared with us.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To learn more about these choices, please see the information provided by your device or software provider.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: How and when we share information

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Anyone can see the public boards and Pins you create and profile information you give us.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We also make this public information available through what are called APIs (basically a technical way to share information quickly).

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, a partner can study what their most popular Pins are or how their Pins are being shared on Pinterest by using a Pinterest API.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We also share your information with:  Other services, at your direction, to enable you to sign up for or log in to Pinterest, or when you decide to link your Pinterest account to those services, like Facebook or Google, or when you publish your content on Pinterest to them.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For example, if you choose to publish your Pins to Facebook or Twitter, then information about that content will be shared with Facebook or Twitter.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Services we use to market Pinterest to you on sites and apps other than Pinterest, such as Facebook Ads, Google Marketing Platform, Microsoft Advertising, LinkedIn Advertising, The Trade Desk and others from time to time.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can opt-out of sharing with such advertising services in your settings.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Online advertisers and third-party companies that we or they use to audit or improve the delivery and performance of ads or content on websites and apps (for example, through Google Analytics).

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: This includes us sharing the Pins or ads you were shown on Pinterest and whether or how you engaged with those Pins or ads, or other information about your activity on Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Learn more about how we share information with online advertisers.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To learn more about third-party companies that analyze ad performance, please visit our Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Law enforcement agencies or government agencies.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Our wholly-owned subsidiaries and affiliates.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If we were to engage in a merger, acquisition, bankruptcy, dissolution, reorganization, or similar transaction or proceeding that involves the transfer of the information described in this Policy, we would share your information with a party involved in such a process (for example, a potential purchaser).

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: How long we keep your information   We keep your information only so long as we need it to provide Pinterest to you and fulfill the purposes described in this policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: This is also the case for anyone that we share your information with and who carries out services on our behalf.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: When we no longer need to use your information and there is no need for us to keep it to comply with our legal or regulatory obligations, we’ll either remove it from our systems or depersonalize it so that we can't identify you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Our policy on children’s information

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Children under 13 are not allowed to use Pinterest.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you are based in the EEA you may only use Pinterest if you are over the age at which you can provide consent to data processing under the laws of your country.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Your options

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You have options in relation to the information that we have about you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: To exercise these options, please visit your account settings and, if you still need help, our Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Request access to the information we collect and hold about you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We'll usually share this with you within 30 days of you asking us for it through our Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Have your information corrected or deleted.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can update your information in your profile or delete your data by closing your account.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Object to us processing your information.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can ask us to stop using your information, including when we use your information to send you marketing emails or push notifications.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you opt out of receiving marketing messages from us, we may still send you updates about your account, such as when someone comments on one of your Pins.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Have the information you provided to us sent to another organization, where we hold this information with your consent or for the performance of a contract with you, and, where it's technically feasible for us to do so.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Request more details about the information we collect and how and why we use and share it.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We will not discriminate against you if you choose to exercise your options related to your personal information.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We work to be clear with you about your options and the consequences of exercising certain options.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you have questions, please contact us.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Residents of the EEA   If you have any questions about our data processing activities, the data controller you should contact is Pinterest Europe Ltd., an Irish company with its registered office at Palmerston House, 2nd Floor, Fenian Street, Dublin 2, Ireland.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can also contact our Data Protection Officer.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you think that we haven't complied with data protection laws, you have a right to lodge a complaint with the Data Protection Commission in Ireland or with your local supervisory authority.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Because Pinterest is a worldwide service, we may transfer the personal data of EEA residents to a country outside the EEA.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: Where we transfer information from the EEA to a country that doesn't provide an adequate level of protection, we’ll only do so under appropriate safeguards to protect your information, like standard contractual clauses.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: California residents   The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) requires us to disclose categories of Personal Information we collect and how we use it, the categories of sources from whom we collect Personal Information, and the third parties with whom we share it, which we have explained above.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We are also required to communicate information about rights California residents have under California law.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You may exercise the following rights:  Right to Know and Access.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You may submit a verifiable request for information regarding the: (1) categories of Personal Information we collect, use, or share.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: (2) purposes for which categories of Personal Information are collected or used by us.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: (3) categories of sources from which we collect Personal Information.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: and (4) specific pieces of Personal Information we have collected about you.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We will not discriminate against you if you exercise your privacy rights.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You may submit a verifiable request to close your account and we will delete Personal Information about you that we have collected.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: In order to verify your identity when you make a request, you will be required to log in to your password-protected account or respond to an email verification request.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We do not sell the Personal Information of our users.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: For more information about these rights, please see “Choices you have about your info” above, and to exercise them, please visit our Help Center or contact us at privacy-support [at] pinterest.com.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: In addition to exercising these rights yourself, you may also designate an authorized agent to make these requests on your behalf.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: In order to do this, we will ask you to verify the request directly via email or through your password-protected account.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: We collect the following categories of Personal Information and in the past 12 months, we have disclosed these categories of Personal Information for a business purpose to affiliates, service providers and third parties, as described in the How and when we share information section of this Privacy Policy:  Identifiers, such as your name, username, email address, phone number, unique device identifiers, and your IP address Personal characteristics protected by law, such as your gender and age Commercial information, such as purchases made, and payment information Internet or electronic network activity information, such as information about your device and your use of our Services Geo-location data, when shared through your device settings or photos Electronic, visual, or similar information, such as your profile picture or photos Professional or employment information, when you link your account to other accounts Inferences we draw or derive about users, such as your interests or preferences Other information you provide, such as your bio, Pins, and comments

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: How we make changes to this policy   We may change this policy from time to time and if we do, we’ll post any changes on this page.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you continue to use Pinterest after those changes are in effect, you agree to the new policy.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If the changes are significant, we may provide a more prominent notice or get your consent, as required by law.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: The best way to get in touch with us or to exercise your options described above is through the Help Center.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: If you live in the United States, Pinterest, Inc. is responsible for your information.

Source.Name: match_3.csv
sent: You can contact Pinterest Inc. at 651 Brannan Street, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA.

sent: Online advertisers or third parties share information with us to measure, report on or improve the performance of ads on Pinterest, or to figure out what kinds of ads to show you on or off of Pinterest.

sent: This includes information about your visits to an advertiser's site or purchases you made from them, or information about your interests from a third-party service, which we might use to help show you ads.
